evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 27, 2025, President Trump issued an executive order entitled 'Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs,' which stripped the vast majority of federal workers of their right to organize and bargain collectively through a labor organization of their choosing

extracted.value: President Trump issued an executive order on March 27, 2025, entitled 'Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs,' stripping federal workers of collective bargaining rights

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The vast overbreadth of the list of excluded agencies and the incongruity between the stated rationale of national security and those agencies' primary functions would itself raise questions that the invocation of national security was pretextual

extracted.value: The executive order's stated national security rationale was pretextual, as it targeted unions opposing Trump's agenda

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The White House Fact Sheet accompanying the Exclusion Order decried actions by 'hostile Federal unions' who had 'declared war on President Trump's agenda,' including by 'filing grievances to block Trump policies.' The Fact Sheet specifically referenced a statement by the 'largest Federal union'—i.e., Plaintiff AFGE—that it was 'fighting back' against President Trump's policies. To further drive home the retaliatory intent of the Exclusion Order, the White House Fact Sheet concluded with the message 'President Trump supports constructive partnerships with unions who work with him.'

extracted.value: White House Fact Sheet referenced unions' opposition to Trump's agenda and stated 'President Trump supports constructive partnerships with unions who work with him'

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Elon Musk, who runs the President's 'Department of Government Efficiency,' reposted on X (formerly Twitter) a post attacking a coalition of institutions as conducting a 'coordinated hit job' against President Trump's agenda. The post called out Plaintiffs AFGE, AFSCME, and NFFE directly by name and claimed '[a]lmost every single lawsuit that has been filed against the second Trump administration has come from this group' and '[t]his is the organization that coordinates all of the lawsuits against the administration.' When reposting the attack, Musk added the comment 'Interesting'.

extracted.value: Elon Musk reposted on X attacking unions AFGE, AFSCME, and NFFE as coordinating lawsuits against Trump administration
